intro: Landolphia stenogyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant produces a starchy tuberous root, which is edible and used in various culinary applications. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and nutritional properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
